experience: You and Ryan both know Denise Gudzikowski, Rama Bokka, and 12 others
You both worked at Charles Schwab
You both worked at Charles Schwab from Nov 2016 to Feb 2017

Defined and implemented an architecture integrating Pivotal Cloud Foundry, MongoDB, Hadoop with Spark to modernize and accelerate our client reporting back-end solution. Providing direction on architecture and design decisions including solution evaluation and selection, buy vs. build, on or off premise, private, public or hybrid cloud, project estimations, technology selection and high level technical design. Lead large and transformational software and infrastructure project implementations ensuring software engineers fully leverage the technology for future solutions and designs. Developing a comprehensive governance and  strategy for the client reporting technology group. Build meaningful relationships with partners in many different parts of the firm to build an integrated client view vision and strategic roadmap. Establishing a governance framework that establish a cross portfolio view for a larger technology group.

Primary liaison between IT and the Field for Central US. Requires significant subject matter expertise for both IT and the field business and the ability to translate and communicate between each. Responsible for maximizing value for the business, assisting in the prioritization of projects, ensuring that IT services and capabilities meet the current and future business needs, and directs IT strategy in support of the overall business strategy	Strategic IT Partner with Business. Resolved IT–related business challenges on behalf of Field Executives. 	Define and deliver on Account Plan commitments & Conditions of Satisfaction, while championing field needs to Microsoft IT as a single and loud voice. This increase overall satisfaction with IT from a business perspective.	CIO-like accountabilities, specifically in External engagements on IT strategy, mobility, BYOD and “How MS IT Does IT”. This resulted in higher sales closure rate, larger value deals, and increased customer satisfaction with Microsoft.

Responsible for the development and implementation of technology strategies to support the development and release of Microsoft products. Accountable for leading the strategic planning across a $60 M portfolio encompassing more than 40 different programs.- Drove the creation of an ITIL based service level management framework across the “Ideation to Availability” business process.  Creating, for the first time, and end-to-end view of the services that our team offers to enable engineering and launch new products.  Through this work defining one view for all stakeholders as they provision services for our customers.- Defined multi-year roadmaps, business strategy maps, capability roadmaps and portfolio roadmaps.  Allowing senior leadership team to effectively prioritize the portfolio of programs to achieve business goals.- Developed an ongoing business relationship with customer team in the role of account manager.  Facilitated account plans, conditions of satisfaction, and served as a primary point of contact for strategic planning.- Lead a work stream responsible for the adoption and implementation of a new organizational structure for a 1500 person division.

Responsible for IT systems project/program management and budget management supporting electronic software distribution.- Lead the execution of the onboarding of 2 new electronic distribution channels, 5 new partners, and 8 distribution programs onto a key distribution system.  This helped realize the business value of a new platform and enabled the retirement of a legacy system saving $1million annually and enabling $419M in sales through this channel.- Responsible for strategy & goal identification, business capability analysis, business process modeling, creation of multi-year roadmaps, solution recommendations, and business value realization practices. - Served as the IT lead in successfully closing out an open audit which had “red” findings.  Worked with business partner to identify solutions that would fulfill the necessary requirements while ensuring that there was minimal impact to the project portfolio.

Responsible for IT systems strategy development, implementation, and support for Planning, Purchasing, Warehousing, Quality, Regulatory, Development and Operations / Manufacturing departments at multiple sites.  In charge of full system lifecycle including development of ROI, application/vendor selection, implementation, validation, and production support.  	Lead a direct staff of 9 individuals located at three US sites supporting 1300 end-users utilizing 20 major and 80 minor applications.	Managed a group of project management professionals to ensure projects were executed on schedule and on budget.  This resulted in high level of customer satisfaction and increased demand for services.	Implemented process improvement to improve resource efficiency and productivity by working closely with senior business executives to prioritize projects across the entire business through governance.  This has enabled the IT group to focus on the highest business value projects.	Facilitated the development of a 5 year strategic technology plan for the Global Product Quality group and Global Manufacturing Operations.  This resulted in a clear technology road-map for the sites.

Samantha Reynolds
Director, Product Management at Microsoft
September 19, 2012, Samantha managed Ryan directly

Ryan was first assigned to my team in a Sr. Solution Manager role but as our team’s needs changed, very helpfully agreed to move into a Business Architect role. He was successful in this new role and as a consequence, was recently assigned a larger scope of work reporting directly to our General Manager to deliver additional customer value. He is a detail focused, consistently solid performer that can be relied upon to manage differing priorities and a heavy, semi-ambiguous workload. He is effective in developing relationships and managing across his peers and partners, as well as interacting with senior leadership. I very much enjoyed working with Ryan and I would recommend him for similar roles without reservation.

Paul Krason
Test Engineering Manager at Accenture
August 9, 2012, Paul reported directly to Ryan

It was a pleasure to work for and with Ryan Reed for several years in the IT dept. at Sandoz.  Ryan managed many disparate IT projects during that time under often extremely difficult and challenging circumstances and deadlines.  His ability to remain calm, thoughtful, ethical, and resolute in the eye of the storm is a rare management trait but Ryan has these abilities in spades.  His leadership strength was very clear from early on and only improved with time.  He is a great communicator, voracious learner, and is constantly improving his knowledge base and skills.  I have very high regards to Ryan's abilities and would enthusiastically recommend him for management/leadership positions in organizations that demand only the very best.

Paul is the consummate professional and it is hard to say enough good things about him and the work that he does.  As a consultant, I would have to say that one of the things that I appreciated most about him was his ability to quickly grasp what was being asked of him, in both the specific task and also the context of the task.  He is a great listener, but is not afraid to challenge the situation when it makes sense.  He is diligent about delivering his work on time and of highest quailty.  One other attribute that I appreciate about Paul is his continual drive to make himself better.  This drive makes him not only more effective, but also helps others around him improve as well.  I would welcome the opportunity to work with Paul again.
